acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value of 3.5mg/L (equivalent to 710ppm) representing the lower of the LC50 values (4 hours) of 3.5mg/L and 7.1mg/L, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of vapour) of 10mg/L (30 min) and 10mg/L (2 hours) (RTECS (2006)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (187,000ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 142 mmHg (25degC) (equivalent to 18.9 kPa), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 120mg/kg (RTECS (2006)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 and Division 6.1 (UN#1099) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is -1degC (c.c.) (NFPA (13th, 2002)) and the boiling point is 71degC, which is classified into "Category 2."  Classified into Class 3 and Division 6.1 (UN#1099) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in NTP DB (Access on June, 2006).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures (flash point: 295degC (NFPA, 13th, 2002))

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin). Classified into Class 3 and Division 6.1 (UN#1099) (UN Recommendation on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on human epidemiological studies (HSDB (2006)): "Causes severe eye burn."

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on human epidemiological studies (HSDB (2006)): "Causes severe skin burn." Although classified into Category 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "respiratory irritation" (HSDB (2003)).
